intro: Stachyphrynium borneense, commonly known as the Bornean stachyphrynium, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many plants with showy inflorescences. The plant typically features a short, rhizomatous stem and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a spadix. Its leaves are broad and arrow-shaped, often with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
